intro: Physichilus barbatus, commonly known as the barbed spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
